title.narrative: Access to medium-term CPand EiE systems

description.narrative: Save the Children brings specific, globally proven expertise in child protection and education the consortium, alongside decades ofexperience working in Uganda. SC occupies a distinct space in the humanitarian architecture as the only NGO that co-leads a Clusterfrom the global level. The position, as the Global Co-Lead of the Education Cluster along with UNICEF, implies great positioning and benefit. This firmly and clearly establishes SC as a leader in Education in Emergencies (EiE) - a status mirrored at the global and national levels - while contributing greatly to the leadership of humanitarian response. Child Protection is also part of the coremandate of Save the Children. In the current ECHO funded project Save the Children is working in established CFSs on further enabling children to understand their rights; access referral mechanisms and have their protection concerns identified by the adults they trust. Caregivers and facilitators then become important child protection actors who can helpfoster inclusive and safe learning environments, identify protection trends and inform decision-making about broad child protection strategies. Save the Children will leadand implement all child protection and education activities proposed under this intervention. Save the Children will follow its global standards which also matches with SPEHERE and HAP standards. SC will support strengthening existing child protection structures i.e. Child Friendly Spaces (CFSs) ensuring the needs, abilities and opportunities of girls, boys, including children with disabilities/special needs, are identified and addressed. The CFS facilitators will be paid a monthly stipend and be provided with other incentives like T-shirts, gumboots, caps and bags. The CFS will be replenished with inside and outside play materials, the CFS facilitators will receive refresher trainings. Topics will include; children's rights, retrogressive cultural practices e.g. child marriages, male preference; gender inequality addressing the rootcauses of these harmful and retrogressive practices and violence against children. Refugee and host community boys and girls will access psychosocial services within the existing CFS in settlements/zones. TheseCFS offer children (7-17 years) a safe place to play, socialize, learn through structured activities, and access psychosocial and other services and information inclusive of health promotive interventions; while trained adults will help develop positive coping mechanisms. SC will also use the CFSas the platform for sensitization and to increase knowledge, skills and ability of children, duty bearers including CFS facilitators, caregivers and community members on child protection, e.g. retrogressive cultural practices- child marriage, laws governing the protection of children, Uganda child helpline 116, and ensuring children's right to health through practice of behaviors that are promoting children's health and responsive care giving.

participating-org.narrative: Save The Children Netherlands works in close partnership with boys and girls, communities, government structures and informal service providers to create conditions to minimize violence, exploitation and abuse of children. SC is recognized as the lead actor in Child Protection(CP) and is visible at a national level in terms of CP systems strengthening, improving mechanisms for protection of children and influences legislative reforms that directly translate to better services for children. SC conducts strategic Education in Emergencies (EiE) and CP in Emergency (CPiE) advocacy jointly with other civil society actors. SC implements a holistic EiE and CPiE approach, having a CFS in most of the ECCD centers in order to respond to PSS needs for children of all ages including case management, referrals, foster or alternative care for UASC, awareness creation and dialogue to create more child responsive communities and Rapid Family Tracing and Reunification (RFTR). The ECCD centers proposed under this action are already established and well running with ECHO funding until the end of October 2017, with new CFS/ECCD centers currently being established in Moyo. SC therefore has the logistical infrastructure, inter-agency partnerships and expert staff already on the ground. In this consortium Save the Children will lead and implement all child protection and education activities proposed under this intervention. Save the Children will follow its global standards which also matches with SPEHERE and HAP standards

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to life and security
